results.title: Chronic infusion of lisinopril into hypothalamic paraventricular nucleus modulates cytokines and attenuates oxidative stress in rostral ventrolateral medulla in hypertension.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renovascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006978 @@@Renovascular hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ received bilateral PVN infusion with @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@LSP@@@, 10mug/h) or vehicle via osmotic minipump for 4weeks.

citations.NLM: Li HB, Qin DN, Ma L, Miao YW, Zhang DM, Lu Y, Song XA, Zhu GQ, Kang YM. Chronic infusion of lisinopril into hypothalamic paraventricular nucleus modulates cytokines and attenuates oxidative stress in rostral ventrolateral medulla in hypertension. results.title: Prevention of angiotensin II induced myocyte necrosis and coronary vascular damage by lisinopril and losartan in the rat.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Control @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ and @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with either @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renovascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006978 @@@renovascular hypertension@@@ or continuous @GENE_AGT @GENE_24179 @@@angiotensin II@@@ infusion (150 ng.min-1) for 14 d were subdivided into nine groups as follows: unoperated and untreated controls (n = 5); untreated @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renovascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006978 @@@renovascular hypertension@@@ (n = 8); untreated @GENE_AGT @GENE_24179 @@@angiotensin II@@@ (n = 9); a @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renovascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006978 @@@renovascular hypertension@@@ group receiving one of the following doses of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 20 (n = 8), 2.5 (n = 4), and 0.6 (n = 6) mg.kg-1.d-1; a @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renovascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006978 @@@renovascular hypertension@@@ group receiving @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ (7.5 mg.d-1, n = 4); and an @GENE_AGT @GENE_24179 @@@angiotensin II@@@ group receiving either the high dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (n = 6) or @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ (n = 4).

citations.NLM: Kabour A, Henegar JR, Devineni VR, Janicki JS. Prevention of angiotensin II induced myocyte necrosis and coronary vascular damage by lisinopril and losartan in the rat. Cardiovasc Res. 1995 Apr;29(4):543-8. PMID: 7796449
citations.BibTeX: @article{7796449, title={Prevention of angiotensin II induced myocyte necrosis and coronary vascular damage by lisinopril and losartan in the rat.}, author={Kabour A and Henegar JR and Devineni VR and Janicki JS}, journal={Cardiovasc Res}, volume={29}, number={4}, pages={543-8}}

results.title: Angiotensin-(1-7) and nitric oxide interaction in renovascular hypertension.
results.text_hl: During the chronic phase of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renovascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006978 @@@renovascular hypertension@@@, the fall in blood pressure produced by acute systemic injections of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ was significantly reduced in @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@ given the @CHEMICAL_Nitric_Oxide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009569 @@@nitric oxide@@@ inhibitor.

citations.NLM: Nakamoto H, Ferrario CM, Fuller SB, Robaczewski DL, Winicov E, Dean RH. Angiotensin-(1-7) and nitric oxide interaction in renovascular hypertension. Hypertension. 1995 Apr;25(4 Pt 2):796-802. PMID: 7536715
citations.BibTeX: @article{7536715, title={Angiotensin-(1-7) and nitric oxide interaction in renovascular hypertension.}, author={Nakamoto H and Ferrario CM and Fuller SB and Robaczewski DL and Winicov E and Dean RH}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={25}, number={4 Pt 2}, pages={796-802}}

results.title: Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors.
results.journal: AACN Clin Issues Crit Care Nurs
results.text_hl: The angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors available today include @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@Capoten@@@), @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Enalaprilat @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015773 @@@Vasotec@@@), enaloprilat (Vasotec IV), @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Prinivil@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Zestril@@@), @CHEMICAL_benazepril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C044946 @@@benazepril@@@ (@CHEMICAL_benazepril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C044946 @@@Lotensin@@@), @CHEMICAL_Fosinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017328 @@@fosinopril@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Fosinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017328 @@@Monopril@@@), and @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@ (Atace).

citations.NLM: Kuhn M. Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors. AACN Clin Issues Crit Care Nurs. 1992 May;3(2):461-71. PMID: 1576040
citations.BibTeX: @article{1576040, title={Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors.}, author={Kuhn M}, journal={AACN Clin Issues Crit Care Nurs}, volume={3}, number={2}, pages={461-71}}

results.title: Captopril administered every three hours in difficult-to-control hypertension.
results.text_hl: Convenient maintenance therapy with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (10 mg twice daily) has kept blood pressure under control for a year.

citations.NLM: Vardan S, Mookherjee S, Smulyan H. Captopril administered every three hours in difficult-to-control hypertension. Chest. 1992 Jul;102(1):303-4. PMID: 1320565
citations.BibTeX: @article{1320565, title={Captopril administered every three hours in difficult-to-control hypertension.}, author={Vardan S and Mookherjee S and Smulyan H}, journal={Chest}, volume={102}, number={1}, pages={303-4}}
